definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to be getting worse with each generation
pinyin: yi1 dai4 bu4 ru2 yi1 dai4

definition: to be getting worse with each generation
pinyin: yi1 dai4 bu4 ru2 yi1 dai4

definition: generation of 1957/refers to Mao's anti-rightist purge of 1957

sentences.english: So in the interest of helping out the next generation of thieves, I'm going to offer you a few pointers.
sentences.chinese: 所以，爲了有助於下一代遊蕩者們，我準備教你幾招。

sentences.english: We validated next generation radios for cars at General Motors.
sentences.chinese: 我們驗證了下一代車輛的無線廣播系統。

sentences.english: Banks are not lining up to lend money on their own for construction of the newest generation of Indian Points.
sentences.chinese: 銀行不會自願貸款給新一代印點核電站的建造。

sentences.english: The next generation of groupware tools focused on these communications problems.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的一代羣件工具是以通信問題爲重點的。

sentences.english: One reason is the increasing upward mobility of the younger generation.
sentences.chinese: 原因之一是年輕一代的上進心增強了。

sentences.english: The legacy of their disobedience is passed down to every generation.
sentences.chinese: 他們的忤逆一代代傳承下來。

sentences.english: But the next generation is much better than our generation in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 但在這方面，下一代人將比我這一代人強很多。

sentences.english: But the next generation is much better than our generation in this respect.
sentences.chinese: 但在這方面，下一代人將比我這一代人強很多。

sentences.english: They will also probably be the best-educated generation in history.
sentences.chinese: 而且，他們可能會是歷史上受教育程度最好的一代。

sentences.english: It establishes the foundation for the next generation of client software.
sentences.chinese: 它們爲下一代客戶端軟件奠定了基礎。

sentences.english: Li Guangyao’s mother also invests her hopes in the next generation.
sentences.chinese: 李光耀的媽媽也在她的下一代上投資着她自己的夢想。

sentences.english: Ready to put him into a new generation of stars instead of Mollys article.
sentences.chinese: 準備把他捧成新一代的巨星代替莫利文。

sentences.english: Thisis the first generation of people who have grown up with bad divorces.
sentences.chinese: 這是第一代在成長過程中目睹了很多不幸婚姻的人。

sentences.english: At first, I agreed we truly were the 'unluckiest generation,' " says Wang Xiping.
sentences.chinese: 最初，我也認爲我們真的是‘最不幸的一代’。

sentences.english: A generation ago, home-schooling was rare and, in many states, illegal.
sentences.chinese: 這種在家接受教育的現象在上一代是不被允許的。

sentences.english: I'm from an immigrant family, first generation here.
sentences.chinese: 我來自移民家庭，是第一代移民。

definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
secondary/twice in the year (of generations of insects, harvests etc)
three generations of a family/the three earliest dynasties (Xia, Shang and Zhou)
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
